intro: Reseda armena var. armena, commonly known as Armenian knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces oval, hairy leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
